headings.usage: Page titles, Card headers, Section titles

body.usage: Table data, Form inputs, General text

rules: Overlines/Labels must be Uppercase + Tiny + Wide Spacing (tracking-widest)
Line height: Tight for headers, Relaxed for body

grid_system.dashboard: Mode B: High Density Grid (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-3 lg:grid-cols-4, gap-6)

cards.style: Flat background, 1px subtle border (border-slate-200), no shadow by default. Hover: shadow-md, -translate-y-1 transition-all

buttons.primary: bg-slate-900 text-white hover:bg-slate-800 rounded-lg px-6 py-2 font-medium transition-all active:scale-95
buttons.secondary: bg-white border border-slate-200 text-slate-900 hover:bg-slate-50 rounded-lg px-6 py-2 font-medium

inputs.style: bg-white border-slate-200 focus:ring-2 focus:ring-orange-500/20 focus:border-orange-500 rounded-lg h-10

tables.style: Clean rows, border-b border-slate-100, hover:bg-slate-50/50. Header: uppercase text-xs font-semibold text-slate-500 tracking-wider

dashboard_welcome.usage: Dashboard welcome banner or widget background

motion.page_transition: initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 10 }} animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }} exit={{ opacity: 0, y: -10 }}

universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style

instructions_to_main_agent: Follow the 'Swiss & High-Contrast' archetype. Use the 'Academic Navy' (#0F172A) as the primary anchor for the sidebar and headings. Use 'Success Orange' (#F97316) sparingly for high-impact actions. The layout must be dense but breathable (Mode B). Use the provided image URLs for the login and dashboard. Ensure all interactive elements have data-testid attributes.
